channel.title: Project: Build a Slackbot on JavaScript
channel.description: Recent content in Project: Build a Slackbot on JavaScript

item.title: Objectives
item.description: Leverage Slack’s API and OpenWeather’s API to build a slackbot that delivers a city’s current weather directly in Slack

item.title: Project Overview
item.description: Project Overview OpenWeatherBot: We will be building a slackbot that allows users to get information about a city’s current weather directly in Slack. Here’s a diagram that provides a high-level view of how our slackbot will work:

item.title: Documentation
item.description: Documentation Since we’ll be the APIs of both Slack and OpenWeather, you should have the API docs of both platforms open in your browser so you can quickly reference them when needed: Slack API Docs OpenWeather API Docs

item.title: Lab: Scrabble Score Bot
item.description: Lab: Add a “Slack Bot” that returns a Scrabble Score for a given word Overview You are tasked with creating a Slack Bot that returns a scrabble score when provided with a word For example: If a user of your ScrabbleScoreBot types in the following slash command into Slack: Then a score of 12 should be returned by the Slack bot Requirements 1) Create a new Slack App called ScrabbleScoreBot (follow the same steps from the OpenWeatherBot tutorial)
